question.body: Which of the following types of molecules have not been found to be associated with the cell membrane?

multiple_choice.choice: all of the above are associated with the membrane

response.feedback: Incorrect. Remember carbohydrates are associated with membrane proteins to form glycoproteins for cell recognition.
Incorrect. The bulk of the membrane is formed by a double layer of phospholipids.
Incorrect. Remember integral and peripheral proteins are critical for the passage of molecules across the membrane that wouldn’t pass through the phospholipid bilayer.
Incorrect. Cholesterol is found in the membrane and contributes to it’s fluidity.
Correct. A cell membrane is mainly composed of a double layer of phospholipids with cholesterol, proteins, and glycoproteins found in and on it.
